formalpara.title: Figure 1. Simple representations of the cell cycle
formalpara.para: (A) a typical (somatic) cell cycle, which can be divided in four sequential phases: G1, S, G2 and M. M phase consist of nuclear division (mitosis) and cytoplasmic division (cytokinesis) (B) variant cell cycles in which specific phases are omitted. (C) approximate time of activity for different combinations of cyclins and CDKs, based on studies of mammalian cyclins and CDKs. C. elegans family members are indicated between brackets. Shapes outside the cycle indicate increase and reduction of corresponding CDK/cyclin activity.
